content:
User: :\ai-execution-system>python -m ensurepip Defaulting to user installation because normal site-packages is not writeable Looking in links: c:\Users\jesse\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpcuhibmsj Requirement already satisfied: pip in c:\program files (x86)\google\cloud sdk\google-cloud-sdk\platform\bundledpython\lib\site-packages (24.3.1) C:\ai-execution-system>pip --version 'pip' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. C:\ai-execution-system>

Gemini: Here's how to add the Python Scripts directory from the Google Cloud SDK to your system's PATH on Windows:

Identify the correct Scripts directory path:

Based on the ensurepip output, the path is likely:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Cloud SDK\google-cloud-sdk\platform\bundledpython\Scripts
Please double-check that this path exists on your computer. Open File Explorer and navigate to this location to confirm that the Scripts folder is there.

Open System Environment Variables:

Press the Windows key, type environment variables, and select "Edit the system environment variables".
The "System Properties" window will open, with the "Advanced" tab selected.
Click the "Environment Variables..." button at the bottom.
Edit the Path System Variable:

In the "System variables" section (bottom part of the "Environment Variables" window), scroll down and find the variable named Path.
Select Path and click the "Edit..." button.
Add the Python Scripts directory:

In the "Edit Environment Variable" window, click "New".

Paste or type the Scripts directory path you confirmed in step 1:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Google\Cloud SDK\google-cloud-sdk\platform\bundledpython\Scripts
Click "OK" to close the "Edit Environment Variable" window.

Click "OK" to close the "Environment Variables" window.

Click "OK" to close the "System Properties" window.

Open a NEW command prompt:

It is crucial to close your current command prompt and open a new one. Environment variable changes are only loaded when a new command prompt is started.

Test pip --version again:

In the new command prompt, type:

pip --version
and press Enter.

Hopefully, this time pip --version will work correctly and show you the pip version.

Please let me know if pip --version now works after you've added the Scripts directory to your PATH. Once pip is working, we can finally install git-filter-repo!
